info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 3 at 5:40PM CDT until June 3 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Green Bay WI
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Wisconsin, including the following counties, in north central Wisconsin, southeastern Langlade. In northeast Wisconsin, southeastern Forest, northern Marinette, northwestern Menominee, northern Oconto and western Shawano.
* WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 539 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Antigo, Wittenberg, Pembine, Goodman, White Lake, Carter, Gardner Dam Scout Camp, McCaslin Mountain Natural Area, Neopit, Langlade, Wabeno, Dunbar, Polar, Townsend, Birnamwood, Lakewood, Silver Cliff, Mattoon, Bowler and Aniwa. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Forest, WI; Langlade, WI; Marinette, WI; Menominee, WI; Oconto, WI; Shawano, WI
